name: Mini Pokemon II
description:
*This is a follow-up on the last Kumite "[Mini Pokemon](https://www.codewars.com/kata/64959cc04b1bbf16a6e348c3/python)" that expands on complexity. I recommend looking at the first version first.*

**Goal:**      
We want to calculate the optimal move to use given an attacking pokemon, and a defending pokemon.
____________

**Description:**          
Additional to type information, pokemon attacks possess a given power level.
Type effectiveness works as a multiplier on the base damage of the move.

```
Effective: 2.0
Normal: 1.0
Ineffective: 0.5
```

So a fire-type move of base-power 40 does 80 damage against a grass-type pokemon.

Each pokemon can learn a variety of moves.
The goal is still to find the best move to use against an opponent.
________________

**Task:**      
Complete the function `get_move()` so that the resulting `Move` is the best move against the given opponent.
If two moves are equally good, use the one with the lower moves list index.
The types are limited to `FIRE`, `GRASS`, and `WATER`.
The base power of a move can be assumed to be an integer (0 <= base-power < 200).

**Classes Available:**    
```python
class Element(StrEnum):
    GRASS
    FIRE 
    WATER

class Move:
    name: str
    element: Element
    power: int
    
class Pokemon:
    element: Element
    moves: list[Move]
```
